info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 01 at 6:48PM EDT until August 01 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Washington County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Greene County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Fayette County in southwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 648 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fredericktown-Millsboro, or 9 miles north of Waynesburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... California, Masontown, Bentleyville, Brownsville, Fredericktown-Millsboro, Perryopolis, Fairdale, Jefferson Boro, Isabella, Ellsworth, West Brownsville, and Roscoe. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
